Class GEDF

java.lang.Object
schedulingAlgorithm.PriorityDrivenSchedulingAlgorithm
schedulingAlgorithm.GlobalSchedulingAlgorithm
schedulingAlgorithm.implementation.GEDF
public class GEDF extends GlobalSchedulingAlgorithm
Global Earliest Deadline First Scheduling Algorithm (GEDF).

GEDF is a global, dynamic-priority scheduling algorithm for real-time systems. It selects the job with the earliest absolute deadline across all cores to execute next. Priorities are assigned based on each job's absolute deadline so that jobs with earlier deadlines receive higher scheduling precedence. This implementation updates each job's current priority using the job's absolute deadline.

Author:
ShiuJia

  • Constructor Details

    • GEDF

      public GEDF()
      Constructs a new GEDF scheduler instance.

      This constructor sets a human-readable name for the algorithm and configures the scheduler to use dynamic priorities, since GEDF derives priorities from job deadlines at runtime.

  • Method Details

    • calculatePriority

      public JobQueue calculatePriority(JobQueue jq)
      Recalculates and assigns job-level priorities for the provided job queue.

      This method iterates through the supplied jq, polling each Job and setting its current priority to a new Priority constructed from the job's absolute deadline. Polled jobs are added to a newly created JobQueue which is returned. Jobs with earlier absolute deadlines will receive higher scheduling priority values.

      Specified by:
      calculatePriority in class GlobalSchedulingAlgorithm
      Parameters:
      jq - the source JobQueue containing jobs whose current priorities will be recalculated; must not be null
      Returns:
      a new JobQueue containing the same jobs with updated current priorities

    • calculatePriority

      public void calculatePriority(TaskSet ts)
      Task-set level priority calculation is not supported for GEDF.

      GEDF operates at the job level (dynamic priorities based on absolute deadlines). Assigning priorities at the TaskSet level is not implemented in this class and will always result in an UnsupportedOperationException.

      Specified by:
      calculatePriority in class GlobalSchedulingAlgorithm
      Parameters:
      ts - the TaskSet for which task-level priorities would be calculated (not used)
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - always thrown because task-set based priority calculation is not supported in this implementation
